TopicTitle: When should you use solar panels

Articles.Content:
Found the answer in an old forum, thought everyone would like these numbers!

Solar Panel Power Output

OX-STAT
Moho: ~1.5
Eve: 0.64
Kerbin: 0.33
Duna: 0.15
Dres: 0.03
Jool: 0.02
Eeloo: 0.01

OX-4L/W
Moho: ~7.5
Eve: 2.99
Kerbin: 1.54
Duna: 0.70
Dres: 0.15
Jool: 0.08
Eeloo: 0.03

Gigantor
Moho: ~110
Eve: 44.37
Kerbin: 22.90
Duna: 10.40
Dres: 2.30
Jool: 1.18
Eeloo: 0.41

All credit to Lord Ferret, who quoted this from who knows where.

Happy rocket flying!
Those numbers are a little out of date, and are about 20% low now, I think. Wasn't it slashy who made a list like this?

I found that the OX-4 series works well enough out at jool for probes who don't use much power, just probe functions and perhaps send some science from time to time, you would need batteries to transmit science anyway. 
An PB-NUK is heavier, far more expensive and overkill for standby probes, anything manned, large or designed to be used a lot get the rtg,

5 hours ago, bewing said:

Those numbers are a little out of date, and are about 20% low now,

I think they're too high.  I get about 0.9 from a Gigantor at Jool.
